definition: flushed with success/proud of one's success (in exams, promotion etc)/as pleased as punch
surname Chun
old variant of 春[chun1]
spring (season)/gay/joyful/youthful/love/lust/life
wind/news/style/custom/manner/CL:陣|阵[zhen4],絲|丝[si1]
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]
idea/meaning/thought/to think/wish/desire/intention/to expect/to anticipate

sentences.english: People always want to live in its days of brilliance, but it is not possible.
sentences.chinese: 人们总是希望过着春风得意的日子，但这是不可能的。

sentences.english: At a time when mountain too proud, uncle Mao Qingyuan the late news.
sentences.chinese: 就在高山春风得意之时，大伯毛清源过世的消息传来。

sentences.english: Career of Liu swallow ice is successful, love is immersed in the crisis however.
sentences.chinese: 刘燕冰事业春风得意，爱情却陷入危机。

sentences.english: Riding on the crest of success , seeing all the flowers in Chang'aN.
sentences.chinese: 春风得意马蹄疾，一日看尽长安花。

sentences.english: Wang, the chairman of BYD Co. , was named China's ri …
sentences.chinese: 中国汽车及电池大亨王传福可谓是春风得意。

definition: fully content with one's achievements (idiom)/complacent
both fame and fortune (idiom)/both virtue and reward
to accomplish one's ambition/a dream come true/to enjoy success
high-spirited/full of mettle
lit. the divine steed Feihuang gallops (idiom)/fig. to achieve meteoric success in one's career
lit. like the sun at noon (idiom)/fig. to be at the peak of one's power, career etc
to rapidly go up in the world/meteoric rise (of a career, social position etc)
disappointed/frustrated
becoming more prosperous with each passing day
rising straight up in a clear sky (idiom); rapid promotion to a high post/meteoric career
the time comes, fortune turns (idiom); to have a lucky break/things change for the better
to win success and recognition (idiom)
(of a political career) everything is going smoothly (idiom)
enormously proud of one's success (idiom); smug/complacent
bitterness finishes, sweetness begins (idiom); the hard times are over, the good times just beginning
to climb step by step/to rise steadily/on the up and up
